sentences.text: Notice of 2017  Annual Meeting   of Stockholders   and Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WEDNESDAY, MAY 10, 201 8:30 A.M. (EDT) Nasdaq FMC Tower 2929 Walnut Street Philadelphia, PA 19104
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARCH 29, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Stockholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors works closely with the management team to develop and execute  a sound strategic and governance framework to ensure Nasdaq is focused on the issues,  investments and application of resources that will position the company to realize its fullest  potential and maximize long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, as stewards of your company,  we helped guide Nasdaq through a period of significant progress that we believe further  establishes a foundation for the company to better serve its clients and the capital markets  in the months and years to come.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased to share with you our progress and  thoughts on the year regarding the actions we took on your behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership for the Future
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cultivating a leadership team with strong vision and a diverse skillset has always been a  priority for this Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Detailed succession planning and talent development are vital to  sound management of risk and the achievement of our long-term objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following a  well-developed, multi-year succession plan, we were extremely pleased to appoint Adena  T. Friedman as President and CEO of Nasdaq.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having spent most of her career at Nasdaq,  Adena brings a passion, energy and insight to the role that we believe uniquely positions her  for success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She was instrumental in helping Bob Greifeld steer the strategic transformation  of the companys business modelwhich now generates approximately 75% of its revenue  from subscription and recurring sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to continuing to work with her as  she builds on the remarkable progress made over the last 14 years under Bobs leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This, along with the other additions to the leadership team, including the appointment of  Michael Ptasznik as EVP, Corporate Strategy and CFO, Stacie Swanstrom as EVP, Corporate  Solutions and Bjrn Sibbern as EVP, Global Information Services, gives us great confidence in  the companys ability to continue to execute on its long-term strategy and growth objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, there were significant leadership transitions announced at the Board level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brje  E. Ekholm, who served as Chairman of our Board from May 2012 through December 2016,  will end his service as a director at our 2017 Annual Meeting after being named CEO of  Ericsson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We thank Brje for his service and contributions to the Board and Nasdaq and wish him well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bob Greifeld, who stepped in to act as Chairman of the Board in January 2017  during this period of transition, also will end his service as a director at the 2017 Annual  Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also wish to thank Bob for his 14 years of service as CEO of Nasdaq.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During his  tenure, he took Nasdaq from a small U.S. equities exchange to a global financial technology  and capital markets franchise that is worth over $11 billion today.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following our 2017  Annual Meeting, the Board will elect a new Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to evaluate our Board  composition to ensure that we have the right balance of viewpoints and expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight of Allocation of Capital and Long-Term Strategic Priorities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sound capital allocation continues to play an important role in the companys strategy and the  achievement of its long-term objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is fully involved in thoughtful allocation of  capital and the investments the company makes in its future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To this end, we re-initiated the  Finance Committee in 2016 to review the corporate capital plan and ensure we remain focused on  maximizing value for our stockholders through the strategic deployment of capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Nasdaq continued to execute across a number of areas that greatly enhance its capabilities  to serve clients and strengthen its competitive position as a leading provider to the global capital  markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, we completed four strategic transactions that enhance our capabilities  across our Market Services segment with the acquisitions of the International Securities Exchange,  the operator of three U.S. equity options exchanges, and Nasdaq CXC, formerly Chi-X Canada, an  alternative Canadian equity trading platform, and across our Corporate Solutions business with the  acquisitions of Marketwired, a global provider of news distribution services, and Boardvantage, a  leading board collaboration and productivity platform.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company is well on its way to achieve the synergy targets for these acquisitions along with the benefits they provide the business and clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the company continued to make progress with important organic investments such   as NFX, Nasdaqs energy futures market, which has represented one of the most successful market  launches in the companys history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NFX continues to grow both volumes and client base since its launch  in 2015 and continues to play a vital role in Nasdaqs overall long-term growth strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Technology has always been fundamental to Nasdaqs strategy to better serve its clients, and as  such, the Board is keenly focused on investments in areas that are driving its future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, the  company made significant progress to enhance its use of emerging technologies like blockchain,  machine intelligence and the cloud.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Staying ahead of these trends is vital to evolving and advancing  the companys Market Technology segment and continuing to meet clients growing demand for these services as the pace of technology change accelerates across the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The high point of these  efforts in 2016 was the development of the Nasdaq Financial Framework, which brings together all the  elements of Nasdaqs market technology capabilities into a single platform.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This framework will enable  clients to take full advantage of all the technology that Nasdaq continues to invest in and develop and  accelerate the pace of their own initiatives and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core to this effort is Nasdaqs robust R&D process, which continues to fund key proofs of concept like  the blockchain-driven proxy voting solution that we are developing in Estonia as well as many others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will continue actively to monitor the R&D process to ensure that Nasdaq is developing the  kinds of opportunities that better serve clients and lead to long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cybersecurity is another area of increasing focus for us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cybersecurity is a critical component of  our risk assessment and mitigation framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To this end, Nasdaq today utilizes an array of tools,  processes and policies to prevent, detect and respond to attacks and ultimately to mitigate risk  for its own internal systems and those of its client-facing systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To this end, in 2016 the Audit  Committee approved a strategic plan that establishes a critical long-term framework to monitor and  mitigate cyber risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Developing and Maintaining a Strong Ethical Culture
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to ensuring a long-term focus, sound capital allocation management practices and  measures to control risk, the Board works very closely with the management team to ensure that  a proper ethical tone is established at the top.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq plays a vital role in the global economy  that is built on trust and doing the right thing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a role model to companies, regulators and the  clients and constituents we serve, we take this responsibility very seriously, and acting with  integrity is a core value of our culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the Board regularly reviews the companys  initiatives and programs to ensure the ongoing development of a strong ethical culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year  the company rolled out a number of new initiatives internally to increase awareness of ethics and  compliance issues and strengthen channels for employees to anonymously bring potential issues  to the management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strong commitment to our values, transparency and sound business  practices have always been crucial to our success and a top focus of the management team and  the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Listening to Your Views
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the highlights and areas of focus mentioned above, your feedback and input are vital  to the progress we make as a public company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, we continue to work with stockholders  to increase the level and transparency of our stockholder engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an example and as a  result of your input, last year we adopted proxy access, which enables stockholders that meet the  requirements set forth in the By-Laws to place a limited number of additional nominees for director  on the ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We view engagement with our stockholders as vital to our long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, your support is important and we value your opinions, suggestions and feedback   about our company and governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can submit your views by writing to us at:   AskBoard@nasdaq.com or Nasdaq Board of Directors c/o Joan Conley, SVP and Corporate Secretary,  805 King Farm Blvd., Rockville, MD 20850.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq continues to play a critical role at the intersection of the capital markets and technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through a thoughtful strategic approach and governance framework, the Board will continue to work  on your behalf to ensure Nasdaq continues advancing its business to better serve broker-dealers,  exchange operators, clients, investors and employeesand foremostyou, our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We thank you again for your support and confidence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of Nasdaq, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to good corporate governance, as it promotes the long-term interests of  stockholders, strengthens Board and management accountability and builds public trust in the  company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance section beginning on page 8 describes our governance  framework, which includes the following highlights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value our stockholders perspectives and maintain a vigorous stockholder engagement  program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we conducted outreach to a cross-section of stockholders owning  approximately 75% of our outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also conducted  quarterly outreach to the governance teams at many of our top institutional holders.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions made for 2016 were aligned with Nasdaqs strong financial and  operational performance and reflected continued emphasis on variable, at-risk compensation  paid out over the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions are intended to reinforce our focus on  performance and sustained, profitable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of our NEOs pay is based on performance and consists primarily of equity- based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 90% of our NEOs total direct compensation was performance- based or at risk in 2016; 62% of our NEOs total direct compensation was equity-based  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total direct compensation includes base salary, annual cash incentive   awards and equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentives are based on achievement of rigorous performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016,  payouts of annual incentives reflected our achievement of above target corporate net  revenues and corporate operating income (run rate), in addition to accomplishment of  strategic objectives and business unit financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The resulting payouts to NEOs ranged  from 110%-166% of targeted amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use long-term incentives to promote retention and reward our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our main long-term  incentive plan for NEOs consists of PSUs based on TSR relative to other companies, including  the S&P 500 companies and a group of peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the three-year period from  January 1, 2014 through December 31, 2016, Nasdaqs cumulative TSR was 86.2%, which  was at the 94th percentile of S&P companies and the 87th percentile of peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This TSR performance resulted in performance vesting of PSUs at 200% of target shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program is grounded in best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our best practices include   strong stock ownership guidelines, a long-standing clawback policy, no tax gross-ups   on severance arrangements or perquisites and no hedging or pledging of Nasdaq stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program does not encourage excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Management Compensation Committees closely monitor the risks associated with our executive compensation program and individual compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We conduct a comprehensive risk assessment of our compensation program annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq is committed to stockholder-focused corporate  governance, and the Board of Directors has adopted clear  corporate policies that promote excellence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policies are  consistent with our commitment to transparency and best- in-class practices, including annual elections of directors,  majority voting for directors in uncontested elections,  elimination of supermajority voting requirements and   last years adoption of proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Procedures for Communicating with the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Corporate Governance Guidelines,  Nasdaq separates the roles of Chairman of the Board and  CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this separation of roles and allocation of  distinct responsibilities to each role facilitates communication  between senior management and the full Board about issues  such as corporate governance, management development,  succession planning, executive compensation and company  performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, we adopted a policy to  require a Lead Independent Director, if the Chairman of the  Board is not an independent director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our governance framework is designed to promote  transparency and ensure our Board has the necessary  authority to review and evaluate our business operations  and make decisions that are independent of management  and in the best interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal is to align  the interests of directors, management and stockholders  and comply with or exceed the requirements of The Nasdaq  Stock Market and applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This governance framework establishes the practices our Board follows with respect to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Separate Roles of Chairman and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaqs President and  CEO, Adena T. Friedman, who has over 20 years experience  in the securities industry, is responsible for the strategic  direction, day-to-day leadership and performance of Nasdaq.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After retiring as Nasdaqs CEO in December 2016, Robert  Greifeld assumed the position of Nasdaqs Chairman from  January 2017 through the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In appointing  Mr. Greifeld as Chairman, the Board determined that doing so  would promote a number of important objectives, including  providing important continuity to the Board leadership during  a period of transition for Nasdaqs management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board  also took into account Mr. Greifelds long-standing relationships  with other members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board was  uniformly of the view that electing him as Chairman for the  transition period through the 2017 Annual Meeting would serve  the best interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Greifeld is not standing for  re-election at the 2017 Annual Meeting; following the meeting,  the Board will elect a new Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to positioning Nasdaq for further growth through ongoing talent  management, succession planning and the deepening of our leadership bench.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard,  formally on an annual basis and informally throughout the year in Executive Session, the  Management Compensation Committee, the Board and the CEO review the succession planning  and leadership development program, including a long-term succession plan for development,  retention and replacement of senior officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has a formal process for reviewing  internal succession candidates through regular interaction during Board meetings and strategy  presentations, individual meetings between directors and potential internal candidates and  internal and external feedback from a variety of sources, including meeting with stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the CEO prepares, and the Board reviews, a short-term succession plan that delineates a temporary delegation of authority to certain officers of the company, if all or a portion of the  senior officers should unexpectedly become unable to perform their duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with  the annual report of the succession plan, the CEO also reports on Nasdaqs program for senior  management leadership development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, the Board initiated a formal CEO succession plan in anticipation of the potential  retirement of Mr. Greifeld at the end of his employment agreement term in February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over  the past five years, the CEO, Board and/or its Committees completed the following CEO succession  activities:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: drafted a CEO success profile, including skills, expertise, and competencies, with input from Board members;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: identified and assessed internal and external candidates for succession against the CEO success  profile;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recruited Adena T. Friedman as President in May 2014 with responsibility for the Information  Services, Listing Services, Corporate Solutions and Market Technology businesses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continued to consider and assess internal and external candidates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: promoted Ms. Friedman to President and Chief Operating Officer in December 2015;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continued to consider and assess internal and external candidates throughout 2016; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: held extensive discussions in Executive Session relating to CEO succession.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the end of 2016, the Board assessed Ms. Friedman against the CEO success profile, considered her  performance in the roles of President and President and Chief Operating Officer and determined her  readiness to assume the role of President and CEO as of January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO and executive session  planning will continue to be a priority for the Board in 2017 and beyond.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Orientation and Continuing Education
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaqs management has day-to-day responsibility for:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i)  identifying risks and assessing them in relation to Nasdaqs  strategies and objectives,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) implementing suitable risk mitigation plans, processes and controls and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) appropriately managing  risks in a manner that serves the best interests of Nasdaq, its  stockholders and other stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq has a Global Risk  Management Committee, comprised of employees, that regularly  reviews risks for materiality and refers significant risks to the  Board or specific Board Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To support the work of the  Global Risk Management Committee, Nasdaq has a Technology  Risk Steering Committee, which is responsible for monitoring  technology and cyber systems risks across the organization,  a Global Compliance Council, which monitors regulatory and  corporate compliance risks across the company, and a Nordic   Local Risk Management Forum, which facilitates and ensures   an effective risk management process in the region.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq   also has an internal Global Risk Management Group that   oversees the enterprise risk management framework, supports   its implementation, and aggregates and reports risk information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our comprehensive orientation programs familiarize new and  existing directors with Nasdaqs businesses, strategies and policies  and assist new directors in developing the skills and knowledge  required for their service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide in-person  or telephonic tutorials to educate Board members regarding new  and evolving businesses and strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, directors  attend continuing education programs at external organizations  and universities that provide relevant learning opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and Committee Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, through an independent consultant, our Board and  Board Committees conduct a self-evaluation to assess the  governing entities effectiveness and adherence to the Corporate  Governance Guidelines and Committee charters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the  evaluation provide an opportunity to identify potential areas of  improvement, resulting in an action plan for the improvements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The processes used to determine Board and Committee  effectiveness include an annual evaluation of the performance  of the Board and each Committee as well as individual Board  members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results are reported to and discussed with the  Board in Executive Session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaqs Board has ultimate responsibility for overseeing risk  management with a focus on the most significant risks facing  the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is assisted in meeting this responsibility  by several Board Committees as described below under Board  Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, non-management directors meet in  Executive Session on a regular basis without the presence of  management to discuss matters, including matters pertaining to  risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq does not believe that the Boards role in risk oversight  has affected its leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have stock ownership policies for  directors, executive officers and other senior executives to  promote a long-term perspective in managing the enterprise  and to help align the interests of our stockholders, executives  and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anti-hedging, anti-pledging and anti-short sale policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  prohibit our directors and executive officers from hedging  their ownership of Nasdaq stock, including (without limitation)  short sales as well as any hedging transactions in derivative  securities (e.g., puts, calls, swaps or collars) related to Nasdaq  stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also prohibit our directors and executive officers  from pledging their shares of Nasdaq stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation clawback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an incentive recoupment  policy that applies to officers with the rank of EVP and above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Responsibility and Focus on Entrepreneurship
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethics: Board and Employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We embrace good governance by holding ourselves to the highest ethical standards in all of our interactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, we have  adopted the Nasdaq Code of Ethics, which is applicable to the  Board, all of our employees, including the principal executive  officer, the principal financial officer and the controller and  principal accounting officer, and contractors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have a  separate Nasdaq Code of Conduct for the Board, which contains  supplemental provisions specifically applicable to directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These codes embody the companys fundamental ethics and  compliance principles and expectations of business conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaqs Corporate Responsibility Program demonstrates  an ongoing commitment to thoughtfully manage our social,  environmental and corporate governance operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate  responsibility encompasses a broad range of disciplines within the  company, including sustainability, philanthropy, volunteerism  and corporate citizenship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good corporate responsibility  practices help us cut costs, create new business opportunities,  attract top talent to the company and support the communities  where we live and work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These codes are supported by the Global Ethics and Corporate  Compliance Program, which is based on industry-leading  practices and is designed to meet or exceed available standards,  including those promulgated by U.S. and European regulators  in the jurisdictions in which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pillars of the program  include structural elements, such as policies, risk assessment,  monitoring, training and communications, and key risk areas,  including anti-bribery and corruption, data privacy and antitrust  and competition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, in 2016 we launched our SpeakUp!
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Program which enhanced existing policies and procedures to  ensure that Nasdaq employees and other stakeholders have  channels to raise issues, seek guidance and report potential  violations of our Code of Ethics or other company policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is administered within the Legal and Regulatory  Group and implemented by cross-functional teams representing all areas of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight is provided by the Global  Compliance Council.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sustainability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq recognizes the growing scarcity of natural  resources and our shared responsibility for the betterment of the  planet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, we embed sustainability into our corporate  structure and way of life.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq was included in the 2016 Dow  Jones Sustainability Index, which honors the most sustainable and  transparently operated companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Helsinki Stock Exchange  has been carbon-neutral since 2011, and again won recognition  for its Green Office programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq was one of 16 companies selected  for the Dow Jones Sustainability North  America Index in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philanthropy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq provides philanthropic assistance to local  communities and institutions in a variety of ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our donation  matching program, open to all employees and contractors,  provides 100% corporate matching funds (and sometimes  more for specific initiatives) for donations to an IRS-registered,  501(c)(3)-compliant organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, over 400 qualifying  donations were made through this program, generating $289,000  in charitable impact.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also launched our first global impact  matching dayGiving Tuesdayin 2016, recording nearly  $100,000 in donations in 24 hours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq again partnered with  Angelwish to send toys to chronically ill children.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company  also continued a separate contributions program that regularly  evaluates charitable causes and institutions for donations, as well  as a system for generating need-based donations in times of crisis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We can only bring the best of Nasdaq to our  clients, stakeholders and each other through  our unwavering commitment to integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strong ethical principles form the very  cornerstones of our mission and values and  are pivotal to everything we do.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adena T. Friedman, President and CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Volunteerism.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A robust and inclusive corporate volunteering  program benefits not only our company and employees, but also  the community.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq offers employees two paid days per  year to donate their time to a worthy cause, and our employees  generated a 150% increase in the use of this benefit in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  company sponsored more than a dozen team volunteering events,  partnering with New York Cares, Junior Achievement, Mentoring  USA, Habitat for Humanity, College Summit and others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq  also awarded its second annual Volunteer of the Year award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We post amendments to and intend to post waivers from the  Nasdaq Code of Ethics (to the extent applicable to the principal  executive officer, the principal financial officer or the controller  and principal accounting officer) or to the Nasdaq Code of Conduct  for the Board on our Investor Relations website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also will  disclose amendments or waivers to the codes in any manner  otherwise required by the standards applicable to companies  listed on The Nasdaq Stock Market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Citizenship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to these activities, Nasdaq  reinforced its corporate citizenship throughout 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By  leveraging the Nasdaq MarketSite Opening and Closing Bell  platform to publicize dozens of charitable causes and non-profit  institutionsat no costNasdaq enhanced media exposure and  public awareness of certain issues, including STEM education,  gender equality, health and fitness, disease prevention and literacy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and original research, the Center supports a wide variety of  like-minded organizations, including non-profits, accelerators,  investors, universities and government agencies, with curriculum  and joint programming to serve local and international audiences.

sentences.text: Proposal 1: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The business and affairs of Nasdaq are managed under the direction of our Board of  Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors have diverse backgrounds and experience and represent a  broad spectrum of viewpoints.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to our Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation and By-Laws  and based on our governance needs, the Board may determine the total number  of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is authorized to have nine directors following our 2017  Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nine nominees identified in this proxy statement has been nominated  by our Nominating & Governance Committee and Board of Directors for election to  a one-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All nominees have consented to be named in this proxy statement and to serve on the Nasdaq Board, if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In an uncontested election, our directors are elected by a majority of votes cast at  any meeting for the election of directors at which a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This election is an uncontested election and therefore, each of the nine nominees must receive  the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast to be duly elected to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares not voted, including as a result of abstentions or broker non-votes, will  not impact the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines require that, in an uncontested election, an  incumbent director must submit an irrevocable resignation as a condition to his or  her nomination for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an incumbent director fails to receive the requisite  number of votes in an uncontested election, the irrevocable resignation becomes  effective and such resignation will be considered by the Nominating & Governance  Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Committee will recommend to the full Board whether or not to  accept the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is required to act on the recommendation and to  disclose publicly its decision-making process with respect to the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All the  incumbent directors have submitted an irrevocable resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committee considers possible candidates suggested  by Board and Committee members, industry groups, stockholders and senior  management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to submitting suggested nominees to the Nominating &  Governance Committee, a Nasdaq stockholder may nominate a person for election  as a director, provided the stockholder follows the procedures specified in Nasdaqs  By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committee reviews all candidates in  the same manner, regardless of the source of the recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition,  the Nominating & Governance Committee may engage a third-party search firm  from time-to-time to assist in identifying and evaluating qualified candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Nominating & Governance Committee has retained the search firm of Spencer  Stuart to help identify director prospects, perform candidate outreach, assist in  reference and background checks and provide other related services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Criteria, Qualifications, Experience and Tenure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating the suitability of individual Board nominees, the  Nominating & Governance Committee takes into account many  factors, including a general and diverse understanding of the  global economy, capital markets, finance and other disciplines  relevant to the success of a large publicly-traded financial  technology company; a general understanding of Nasdaqs  business and technology; the classification requirements under  our By-Laws; the individuals educational and professional  background and personal accomplishments; and factors such as  geography, gender, age and diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee evaluates  each individual candidate in the context of the Board as a whole,  with the objective of maintaining a group of directors that can  further the success of Nasdaqs business, while representing  the interests of stockholders, employees and the communities  in which the company operates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether to  recommend a Board member for re-election, the Nominating  & Governance Committee also considers the directors past  attendance at meetings, participation in and contributions to the  activities of the Board and the most recent Board self-assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaqs common stock is currently listed on The Nasdaq Stock  Market and Nasdaq Dubai.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to qualify as independent  under the listing rules of The Nasdaq Stock Market, a director  must satisfy a two-part test.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, the director must not fall into  any of several categories that would automatically disqualify  the director from being deemed independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, no  director qualifies as independent unless the Board affirmatively  determines that the director has no direct or indirect relationship  with the company that would interfere with the exercise of  independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of   a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Nasdaq Dubai listing rules and the Markets  Rules of the Dubai Financial Services Authority, a director is  considered independent if the Board determines the director  to be independent in character and judgment and to have no  commercial or other relationships or circumstances that are likely to affect, or could appear to impair, the directors judgment   in a manner other than in the best interests of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon detailed written submissions by each individual,  the Board has determined that all of our current directors and  director nominees are independent under the rules of each of The Nasdaq Stock Market and Nasdaq Dubai, other than Ms. Friedman  and Mr. Greifeld.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Friedman is deemed not to be independent  because she is Nasdaqs President and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Greifeld is  deemed not to be independent because he is Nasdaqs Chairman,  which is currently an executive officer position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The average Board tenure of Nasdaqs  independent director nominees is 6.3  years compared to 8.2 years for S&P   500 companies.

sentences.text: Pay for Performance Framework
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our executive compensation program to reward financial and operational performance, effective strategic leadership and achievement of business unit goals and objectives, which are  key elements in driving stockholder value and sustainable growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program   is grounded in best practices and ethical and responsible conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Governance Features of Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the specific features of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation practices drive performance and serve our stockholders  long-term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We DO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We DONT Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for performance; 100% of annual incentives and annual long-term  incentive grants are performance-based  Guarantee bonus payments for our NEOs Maintain robust stock ownership guidelines Allow hedging or pledging of Nasdaq stock Maintain a long-standing incentive clawback policy  Award non-performance based stock options Provide change in control protection that requires a double trigger  Pay tax gross-ups on severance arrangements and perquisites Provide only limited perquisites, which provide nominal additional   assistance to allow executives to focus on their duties Provide ongoing supplemental executive retirement plans;   all benefits have been frozen Conduct a comprehensive annual risk assessment   of our compensation program Permit re-pricing of underwater stock options without   shareholder approval Accrue or pay dividends on unearned or unvested   equity awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program reinforces the importance of  meeting and/or exceeding performance targets through  superior awards for superior performance and through  differentiated awards based on performance achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, compensation plans and arrangements do not  encourage excessive risk-taking by management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have endeavored to create a performance-based  compensation program that meets the needs of our global  company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, the  Management Compensation Committee reviews Nasdaqs  compensation philosophy, programs and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following core principles reflect the Management  Compensation Committees current compensation philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program enables Nasdaq to compete  effectively for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is designed to attract,  motivate and retain talented, high-performing individuals   who are willing to commit to our success and to build   long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program creates long-term stockholder  value by fostering an ownership culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We promote employee stock ownership by granting long-term incentives to all  employees and providing the ability to buy shares through   our ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We communicate compensation objectives and program  clearly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ongoing employee educational programs ensure that  the compensation objectives and program are well understood and serve as an effective motivational tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program focuses on key business objectives Our compensation program starts with strategic and financial  goals and objectives, which inform all compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions are also strongly influenced by client  focus, regulatory compliance and ethical behavior.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program supports a high-performance  environment via performance-based rewards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable pay is emphasized over fixed pay through participation of   all employees in annual and long-term incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our philosophy is based on the following guiding principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each individual component of compensation  is considered independently and is not based on a formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each component, however, is intended to be  complementary to the overall compensation package awarded to the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay For Performance Retention Competitive Market Analysis A substantial portion of compensation is   variable or at risk and directly linked  to individual, company and business unit  performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term vesting features ensure that  an employee must remain with the  company for a period of time to receive  value from an award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total compensation is sufficiently competitive with  industry peers to attract and retain executives with similar  levels of experience, skills, education and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal Equity Collateral Implications Stockholder Alignment Compensation takes into account the   different levels of responsibilities, scope,   risk, performance and future potential   of our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our total compensation mix encourages  executives to take appropriate, but  not excessive, risks to improve our  performance and build long-term  stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The financial interests of executives are aligned with the  long-term interests of our stockholders through stock- based compensation and performance metrics   that correlate with long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on Pay Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Determinations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have established a process for evaluating the  performance of the company, the CEO and other NEOs for  compensation purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, the Management  Compensation Committee, the Board and Nominating &  Governance Committee review our CEOs performance in  Executive Session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of their deliberative process, the  Management Compensation Committee and Board evaluate  our CEOs performance against the pre-established corporate  goals and determine appropriate CEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The factors  considered include our CEOs performance against annual  performance objectives, the performance of the company,  the quality and development of the management team and  employee engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the last three consecutive years, more  than 98% of the votes cast on our say- on-pay proposal were in favor of our  executive compensation program   and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year we carefully consider the results of our Say  on Pay advisory vote from the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016  Annual Meeting of Stockholders, over 98% of the votes cast  were in favor of the advisory vote to approve executive  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These results demonstrated significant  stockholder support of our compensation programs design  and goals, and we took into account the results of this  advisory vote when making compensation decisions through  the remainder of 2016 and into early 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to  the Say on Pay results, we also consider many other factors  in evaluating our executive compensation programs, including  our pay for performance philosophy and a competitive market analysis of peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our Say on Pay  results and these other factors, in 2016 we retained the core  elements of our executive compensation program, policies  and decisions and believe that our programs continue to  appropriately motivate and reward our senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the support of the Human Resources Department,   our CEO develops compensation recommendations for the  executive officers for consideration by the Management  Compensation Committee and/or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this  process, our CEO meets individually with each executive  to discuss his or her performance against pre-established  objectives determined during the previous year, as well as  performance objectives and development plans for the coming  year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This meeting gives each executive an opportunity to  present his or her perspective of his or her performance and  potential objectives and challenges for the upcoming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  CEO presents the results of each of the executive meetings to  the Management Compensation Committee for its review and  consideration as part of its deliberation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the perspective provided by the Say on Pay  results, we also carefully solicit and consider feedback from  our stockholders on executive compensation, corporate  governance and other issues throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We welcome  input from our stockholders on our executive compensation  program through the communication process discussed in  Stockholder Communication with Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Screening Criteria  Used to Select   Peer Companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive Positioning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To evaluate the external competitiveness of our executive compensation  program, we compare certain elements of the program to similar elements  used by peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting 2016 compensation levels, the Management Compensation Committee used a comprehensive peer group, consisting of 20  companies, to conduct a competitive market analysis of the compensation  program for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe using and disclosing a peer group supports  good governance and provides valuable input into compensation levels and  program design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REVENUE SIZE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When forming the peer group, we considered potential peers among both  direct industry competitors and companies in related industries with similar  talent needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After identifying potential peers on this basis, we used the seven  screening criteria to the right to select appropriate peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARKET   CAPITALIZATION SIZE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these factors was initially weighted equally to develop a more refined list of companies for consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We then further reviewed each remaining  company to determine its appropriateness for the final peer group with   a particular focus on identifying meaningful talent peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain companies  were eliminated because of factors such as a significantly different market  capitalization, limited competitive position for executive talent or limited global  complexity relative to Nasdaq.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FINANC 3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the current peer group includes an accurate representation of  Nasdaqs industry competitors and size-relevant, talent-focused comparators.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we believe that year-over-year consistency in peer group usage   is desirable for reviewing trends in market pay movement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Consultants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our Human Resources Department engaged Meridian  Compensation Partners to assist staff in gathering data,  reviewing best practices and making recommendations to the  Management Compensation Committee about our executive  compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian does not provide any  other services to Nasdaq other than executive compensation  consulting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian does not directly advise the Management  Compensation Committee or attend meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we  paid Meridian $48,184 in fees for competitive market data for  executives and outside directors and $83,321 in fees for other  executive compensation services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Meridian does not  determine or recommend the amount or form of executive or  director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer group data serves as only one reference point in evaluating our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use this data to  see how various elements of our executive compensation  program compare to other companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we do not  set the compensation of our executives based on this data or  target executive compensation to a specific percentile of the  compensation set by our competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the comparison  is conducted solely to determine if the compensation is  competitive to the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive is evaluated  individually based on skills, knowledge, performance, growth  potential and, in the Management Compensation Committees  business judgment, the value he or she brings to the  organization and Nasdaqs retention risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally Sheets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEOs Role in the Executive Compensation Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When recommending compensation for the CEO and other  NEOs, the Management Compensation Committee reviews  tally sheets that detail the various elements of compensation  for each executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These tally sheets are used to evaluate  the appropriateness of the total compensation package, to  compare each executives total compensation opportunity with  his or her actual payout and to ensure that the compensation  appropriately reflects the compensation programs focus on  pay for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO regularly attends Management Compensation  Committee meetings at the invitation of the Management  Compensation Committee and provides his (or in 2017, her) perspective to the Management Compensation Committee  regarding executive compensation matters generally and   the specific performance of the other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Mitigation and Other Pay Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except in employment agreements and other agreements for  certain officers as described in this proxy statement, we are not  obligated to pay general severance or other enhanced benefits to  any NEO upon termination of his or her employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However,  the Management Compensation Committee and/or the Board has  the discretion to pay severance plan benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance plan  decisions do not influence other compensation decisions as these  decisions are focused on motivating our executives to remain  with Nasdaq and contribute to our future success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Assessment of Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We monitor the risks associated with our compensation program  on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Management  Compensation Committee and Audit Committee were presented  with the results of an annual formal assessment of our employee  compensation program in order to evaluate the risks arising from  our compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This risk assessment  report reflected a comprehensive review and analysis of  the components of our compensation program, including  the performance measures established under the 2017 cash  performance-based incentive award program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Management  Compensation Committee and Audit Committee both concluded,  based on the risk assessment reports findings, that any risks  arising from our compensation program are not reasonably likely  to have a material adverse effect on the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in control severance is defined in employment  agreements for certain NEOs, as described in this proxy, and  in a change in control severance policy for NEOs without an  employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the terms for triggering  payment under each of the arrangements described in this proxy  statement are reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, these arrangements use  what is known as a double trigger, meaning that a severance  payment as a result of a change in control is activated only  upon the occurrence of both a change in control of the company  and a loss of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under these arrangements  will be provided only if Nasdaq is the target organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  addition, a change in control under these arrangements is limited  to situations where the acquirer obtains a majority of Nasdaqs  voting securities or the current members of our Board (or their  approved successors) cease to constitute a majority of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The risk assessment was performed by an internal working  group consisting of employees in the Human Resources, Risk  Management and Internal Audit Departments, as well as the  Offices of General Counsel and Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The findings  were presented to the Global Risk Management Committee,  which concurred with the working groups report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The risk  assessment included the following steps:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: collection and review of existing Nasdaq compensation  policies and pay structures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For further information on Nasdaqs limited severance  arrangements, see Executive Compensation Tables    Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: development of a risk assessment scorecard, analysis  approach and timeline;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: conducting a qualitative risk assessment of performance  goals to determine overall risk level; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because our executive compensation program emphasizes  pay for performance, it includes very few perquisites for our  executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under his employment agreement, for security  reasons, we provide Mr. Greifeld with a company car and  security-trained driver for use when conducting company  business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers at the level of SVP and above are eligible to  receive basic financial planning services and executive health
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: review and evaluation of controls that might mitigate risk- taking (e.g., equity vesting structure, incentive recoupment policy and stock ownership guidelines).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have long recognized the importance of stock ownership  as an essential means of closely aligning the interests of our  executives with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition  to using equity awards as a primary long-term incentive  compensation tool, we have in place stock ownership guidelines  for our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Management  Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing the stock  ownership guidelines annually and verifying compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq permits all employees, including the NEOs, to enter  into plans established under Rule 10b5-1 of the Exchange Act  to enable them to trade in our stock, including stock received  through equity grants, during periods in which they might  not otherwise be able to trade because material nonpublic  information about Nasdaq has not been publicly released.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These  plans include specific instructions to a broker to trade on behalf  of the employee if our stock price reaches a specified level or if  certain other events occur and therefore, the employee no longer  controls the decision to trade.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the guidelines, the covered executives are expected to  own specified dollar amounts of Nasdaq common stock based  on a multiple of their base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The multiple is determined  by officer level: our CEO must hold shares valued at six times  base salary, our CFO must hold a four times multiple, other EVPs  must hold a three times multiple and SVPs and Vice Chairmen  must hold a one times multiple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual holdings, shares  jointly owned with immediate family members or held in trust,  shares of restricted stock (including vested and unvested), shares  underlying PSUs after completion of the performance period  and shares purchased or held through Nasdaqs plans, such as  the Nasdaq ESPP, count toward satisfying the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New  executives and executives who incur a material change in their  responsibilities are expected to meet the applicable level of  ownership within four years of their start date or the date of the  change in responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the NEOs who were required   to be in compliance with the guidelines on December 31, 2016   were in compliance with the guidelines as of that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Recoupment Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and Management Compensation Committee have  adopted an incentive recoupment or clawback policy that is  applicable to officers with the rank of EVP and above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy  provides that the company may recoup any cash or equity  incentive payments predicated upon the achievement of financial  results or operating metrics that are subsequently determined  to be incorrect on account of material errors, material omissions,  fraud or misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Implications of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Management Compensation Committee considers the income  tax consequences of individual compensation elements when  it is analyzing the overall level of compensation and the mix of  compensation among individual elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as  amended, provides a limit of $1 million on the remuneration that  may be deducted by a public company in any year in respect of  the CEO and the three other most highly compensated executive  officers (other than the principal financial officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However,  performance-based compensation is fully deductible if the   plan under which the compensation is paid has been approved by the stockholders and meets other requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We attempt to structure our compensation arrangements so that amounts paid  are tax deductible to the extent feasible and consistent with our  overall compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depending upon the relevant  circumstances at the time, the Management Compensation  Committee may determine to award compensation that may   not be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this determination, the  Management Compensation Committee balances the purposes  and needs of our executive compensation program against the  potential tax implications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Holding Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage our senior executives to retain equity grants until  the applicable stock ownership level discussed above is reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the stock ownership guidelines, these officers must hold  the specified dollar amounts of stock through the end of their  employment with Nasdaq.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We feel that our guidelines provide  proper alignment of the interests of our management and our  stockholders and therefore, we do not have additional stock  holding requirements beyond the stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Trading Controls and Hedging and Pledging Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit directors or executive officers from engaging  in securities transactions that allow them either to insulate  themselves, or profit, from a decline in Nasdaqs stock price  (with the exception of selling shares outright).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, these  individuals may not enter into hedging transactions with respect  to Nasdaqs common stock, including short sales and transactions  in derivative securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, these individuals may not pledge, hypothecate or otherwise encumber their shares of Nasdaq  common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, under U.S. GAAP, compensation is expensed as  earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally recognize compensation expense for equity awards on a straight-line basis over the requisite   service period of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since Mr. Greifeld has decided  not to stand for re-election at the 2017 Annual Meeting, the  agreement is expected to terminate on that date.

sentences.text: The Board of Directors  unanimously recommends a vote to conduct future  advisory votes on  executive compensation  every ONE YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 3: Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Future Advisory Votes on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are asking shareholders to  vote on whether future advisory votes on executive compensation of the  nature reflected in Proposal 2 should occur every year, every two years or  every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, stockholders recommended that advisory votes  on executive compensation be held on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Board  adopted a policy providing for annual stockholder advisory votes to approve the  companys executive compensation, and we have submitted such proposals to our  stockholders at each Annual Meeting since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While annual advisory votes on executive compensation may not be appropriate  for every company, the Board believes that such votes are the most appropriate  option for Nasdaq at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual advisory vote on executive  compensation allows our stockholders to provide us with their direct, timely input  on our compensation objectives, policies and practices as disclosed in the proxy  statement every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holding an annual advisory vote on executive compensation  is also consistent with our practice of seeking input and engaging in dialogue with  our stockholders on a regular basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive  compensation is not binding on the Board of Directors and Management  Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although non-binding, the Board of Directors and the  Management Compensation Committee will carefully review the voting results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the Boards recommendation and the outcome of the stockholder  vote, the Board of Directors may in the future decide that it is in the best interests  of the stockholders and the company to conduct an advisory vote on executive  compensation more or less frequently than the frequency preferred by our  stockholders and may vary its practice based on factors such as discussions with  stockholders and the adoption of material changes to compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
