sentences.text: Mr. Kenneth Steiner, 14 Stoner Ave., 2M, Great Neck, NY 11021, owner of no less  than 500 shares of Nasdaq common stock, has informed Nasdaq that he plans to  introduce the following proposal at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not responsible  for the accuracy or content of the proposal and supporting statement, which are  presented below as received from the proponent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To make sure readers can easily  distinguish between material provided by the proponent and material provided by the company, we have put lines around material provided by the proponent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Proposal and Supporting Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 5  Right to Act by Written Consent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, Shareholders request that our board of directors undertake such steps as may be necessary to permit written consent by shareholders entitled to cast  the minimum number of votes that would be necessary to authorize the action  at a meeting at which all shareholders entitled to vote thereon were present  and voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This written consent is to be consistent with applicable law and  consistent with giving shareholders the fullest power to act by written consent  consistent with applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes shareholder ability to initiate any  topic for written consent consistent with applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal topic won majority shareholder support at 13 major companies in  a single year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This included 67%-support at both Allstate and Sprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hundreds of  major companies enable shareholder action with written consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking action by written consent in lieu of a meeting is a means shareholders  can use to raise important matters outside the normal annual meeting cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder right to act by written consent and to call a special meeting are  2 complimentary ways to bring an important matter to the attention of both  management and shareholders outside the annual meeting cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking action  by written consent saves the expense of holding a special shareholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NDAQ shareholders support topics to improve our corporate governance such as this proposal and the 2016 proxy access proposal which received 75%  shareholder support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote to enhance shareholder value:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Right to Act by Written Consent  Proposal 5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER ITEMS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: distract management and the Board from their focus on increasing  long-term stockholder value, and result in significant administrative  burdens and expenses, with little or no corresponding benefit to  stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Statement in Opposition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has carefully considered the stockholder  proposal and the rejection by Nasdaqs stockholders of a  substantially similar proposal submitted by the same proponent at  the 2015 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that  the actions requested by the proponent are not in the best interests of Nasdaq and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaqs Existing Corporate Governance Structure Provides  Numerous Opportunities for Stockholder Action in a   Transparent Manner
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given Nasdaqs current governance procedures, the Board believes  the adoption of this proposal is not only inappropriate but also  unnecessary because stockholders have ample opportunity to  take action at a properly called stockholders meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaqs  governance documents allow stockholders to nominate persons for  election to the Board or propose other business to be considered  at an annual or special meeting called by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition,  stockholders holding as little as 15% of Nasdaqs voting power who  satisfy the requirements in our By-Laws may call a special meeting  of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These procedures allow our stockholders to bring  important matters before all stockholders for consideration in a  transparent manner, while providing the Board with an adequate  opportunity to examine any proposed action and provide a  carefully considered recommendation to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Again,  action at a meeting, whether annual or special, is preferable to  action by written consent because a meeting ensures that all  stockholders receive notice of the proposals under consideration,  allows the Board to make a considered recommendation regarding  the topics for voting and gives all stockholders an opportunity to  participate in the voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Action by Written Consent Does Not Promote Transparent Decision Making
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has a strong commitment to transparency in Nasdaqs  governance processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board therefore objects to the proposal  because it could allow actions to be taken by a few stockholders  outside of the open and transparent forum of a stockholders  meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, any matter that Nasdaq or its stockholders  wish to present for a stockholder vote must be noticed in advance  and presented at a meeting to which all stockholders are invited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process allows all stockholders to consider, discuss and vote  on pending stockholder actions, as well as have a meaningful and  structured opportunity to exchange views with the Board before  acting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposal, if implemented, allows a small group of stockholders  with no fiduciary duties to other stockholders to act on significant  matters without providing prior notice to the company, any of  the other stockholders or the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In other words, adoption  of this proposal could result in action being taken without some  stockholders knowledge or participation, thereby disenfranchising  those stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adoption of this proposal is also unnecessary because we have  adopted a number of best practices that enhance stockholder  rights and participation in our governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such practices include  our annual elections of directors, majority voting for directors in  uncontested elections and elimination of supermajority voting  requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, last year in response to feedback from  our stockholders, we adopted a proxy access provision that allows  a stockholder or group of stockholders, who comply with certain  requirements, to nominate candidates for service on the Board and  have those candidates included in the companys proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Action by Written Consent Could Allow a Small Group of  Stockholders to Promote Their Self-Interest at the Expense   of All Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, action by written consent could be used to promote the  narrow self-interests of some stockholders (including those who  accumulate a short-term voting position through the borrowing  of shares) that are inconsistent with the long-term best interests  of the company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that all  stockholders should have the opportunity to consider, discuss and  vote on pending significant matters through the transparent forum  of a stockholders meeting, where they may consider arguments for  and against any action, including the companys position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company also uses numerous means to seek out stockholder  views outside the confines of formal stockholders meetings,  considers that input and acts accordingly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, we  participate in regular engagement with our stockholders on  executive compensation, corporate governance and other issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Action by Written Consent Could Create Confusion and Disruption  for Stockholders and the Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, action by written consent can create substantial confusion  and disruption for stockholders and the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Multiple  stockholder groups could solicit multiple written consents  simultaneously, some of which may be duplicative or contradictory.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Permitting action by written consent outside of, and in addition to,  the traditional, transparent setting of a stockholders meeting is a  potentially cumbersome and time-consuming process that could
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in 2015, the Board of Directors believes that the stockholder  proposal to allow stockholder action by written consent is  inappropriate, unnecessary and not in the best interests   of Nasdaq and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. What do I need to do to attend the Annual Meeting?

sentences.text: If you wish to attend the Annual Meeting, you must be a  stockholder on the record date and request an admission ticket  in advance by visiting www.proxyvote.com and following the  instructions provided (you will need the 12 digit number included  on your proxy card, voter instruction form or notice).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tickets will  be issued only to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests for admission tickets will  be processed in the order in which they are received and must be  requested no later than 11:59 p.m. (EDT) on May 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please  note that seating is limited and requests for tickets will be accepted on a first-come, first-served basis.

sentences.text: Questions and Answers About Our Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. What is included in the proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is a proxy  statement and what is a proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy materials for our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders  include the Notice of Annual Meeting, this proxy statement, our  annual report on Form 10-K and our online annual report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you  received a paper copy of these materials, the proxy materials also  include a proxy card or voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy statement is a document that SEC regulations require us to give you when  we ask you to sign a proxy designating individuals to vote on  your behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proxy is your legal designation of another person  to vote the stock you own.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That other person is called a proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you designate someone as your proxy in a written document,  that document also is called a proxy or a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have  designated two of our officers as proxies for the 2017 Annual  Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These two officers are Edward S. Knight  and Joan C. Conley.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The form of proxy and this proxy statement  have been approved by the Board of Directors and are being  provided to stockholders by its authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the meeting, each stockholder will be required to present valid  picture identification, such as a drivers license or passport with  their admission ticket.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of Nasdaq  shares held by a bank, broker or other nominee, you also will  need proof of ownership to be admitted to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A recent  brokerage statement or letter from the bank, broker or other  nominee is an example of proof of ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you want to vote in  person and your Nasdaq shares are held by a bank, broker or other  nominee, you will have to obtain a proxy, executed in your favor,  from the holder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directions to the Annual Meeting are available on our Annual  Meeting Information webpage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cameras (including cell phones with  photographic capabilities), recording devices and other electronic  devices will not be permitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may be required to enter through  a security check point before being granted access to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. What different methods can I use to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may submit written questions in advance of the  meeting by visiting our stockholder forum at www.proxyvote.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote by any of the following methods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice of Internet availability of proxy materials  contains the website address (www.proxyvote.com) for Internet  proxy submission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internet proxy submission is available 24 hours a day until 11:59 p.m. (EDT) on May 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must enter your  control number, which is printed in the lower right hand corner  of the notice of Internet availability and you will be given the  opportunity to confirm that your instructions have been properly  recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. What is the difference between holding shares as a stockholder  of record and as a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our  registrar and transfer agent, Computershare, you are considered a  stockholder of record with respect to those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares  are held in a bank or brokerage account, you are considered the  beneficial owner of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. What if I am a beneficial owner and do not give voting  instructions to my broker?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is a broker non-vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the U.S. and Canada, you can vote your shares by  calling +1 800 690 6903.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Telephone proxy submission is available  24 hours a day until 11:59 p.m. (EDT) on May 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When you  submit a proxy by telephone, you will be required to enter your  control number.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will then receive easy-to-follow voice prompts  allowing you to instruct the proxy holders how to vote your shares  and to confirm that your instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are located outside the U.S. or Canada, you should instruct the  proxy holders how to vote your shares by Internet or by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a beneficial owner, in order to ensure your shares are voted in  the way you would like, you must provide voting instructions to  your bank, broker or other nominee by the deadline provided in  the materials you receive from your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not provide voting instructions to your bank, broker or  other nominee, whether your shares can be voted by such person  depends on the type of item being considered for vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to submit a proxy by mail after requesting and  receiving printed proxy materials, simply complete, sign and date  your proxy card and return it in the postage-paid envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary Items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of the appointment of Ernst  & Young LLP as independent registered public accounting firm is a  discretionary item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Banks, brokers and other nominees that do not  receive voting instructions from beneficial owners may vote on thi proposal in their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10. What proposals are to be voted on at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, and what are the voting standards?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal Our Boards   Recom- mendation Voting   Standard Effect of  Abstentions and  Broker Non-Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Election of   nine directors FOR EACH  NOMINEE Majority of  votes cast Not counted as  votes cast and  therefore have  no effect
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Advisory vote  to approve the  companys executive  compensation  FOR Majority of  the votes  present in  person or  represented  by proxy Abstentions  have the  effect of a  vote against  the proposal;  broker non- votes have no  effect
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Advisory vote  on the frequency  of future advisory  votes on executive  compensation ONE   YEAR Plurality of  votes cast Not counted as  votes cast and  therefore have  no effect
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. Ratification of the  appointment of Ernst  & Young LLP as our  independent registered  public accounting firm  for the fiscal year  ending December 31,  2017 FOR Majority of  the votes  present in  person or  represented  by proxy Abstentions  have the  effect of a  vote against  the proposal;  there will not  be broker non- votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. Stockholder proposal   right to act by written  consent  AGAINST Majority of  the votes  present in  person or  represented  by proxy Abstentions  have the  effect of a  vote against  the proposal;  broker non- votes have no  effect
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Discretionary Items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the other proposals in this proxy  statement are non-discretionary items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Banks, brokers and other  nominees that do not receive voting instructions from beneficial  owners may not vote on these proposals, resulting in a broker  non-vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares through a bank, broker or other nominee,  it is important that you cast your vote if you want it to count on   all of the matters to be considered at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. What can I do if I change my mind after I vote my shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can change your vote by revoking your proxy at any time  before it is exercised in one of three ways: submit a later dated  proxy (including a proxy submitted through the Internet at www. proxyvote.com, by telephone or by proxy card); notify Nasdaqs  Corporate Secretary by email at corporatesecretary@nasdaq.com  that you are revoking your proxy; or vote in person at the Annual  Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of Nasdaq shares held by a bank,  broker or other nominee, you will need to contact the bank, broker  or other nominee to revoke your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. How many votes do I have?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of common stock has one vote, subject to the voting  limitation in our Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation  that generally prohibits a stockholder from voting in excess of 5%   of the total voting power of Nasdaq.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8. Are votes confidential?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies, ballots and voting instruction forms are handled   on a confidential basis to protect your voting privacy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information will not be disclosed other than to those   recording the vote, except if there is a proxy contest, if the  stockholder authorizes disclosure, to defend legal claims or as  otherwise required by law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you write comments on your proxy,  ballot or voting instruction form, management may learn how you  voted in reviewing your comments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy provides that each stockholder may vote his or her  Nasdaq shares For, Against or Abstain on individual nominees  and each of the other proposals, except on Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may vote Every Year, Every Two Years, Every Three Years or  Abstain on Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whichever method you select to transmit  your instructions, the proxy holders will vote your shares as  provided by those instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you provide a proxy without  specific voting instructions, the proxy holders will vote your  Nasdaq shares in accordance with the Board recommendations  noted above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9. What constitutes a quorum for the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence of the holders of a majority (greater than 50%) of  the votes entitled to be cast at the meeting constitutes a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presence may be in person or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker  non-votes are counted as present and entitled to vote at the  meeting for purposes of determining a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The votes to approve executive compensation and on the frequency of future votes on executive compensation are advisory only and,  therefore, the result of these votes will not be binding on our  Board or Management Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board and  Management Compensation Committee will, however, consider  the outcome of these votes when evaluating our executive  compensation program in the future and when determining how  often to hold future advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stockholder proposal is precatory, meaning that it requests that  the Board take a specific action, and therefore, the results of the vote  on that proposal will not be binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the stockholder  proposal is not properly presented by the proponent at the Annual  Meeting, it will not be voted upon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will furnish, without charge, a copy of the annual report   on Form 10-K, including the financial statements, to any stockholder upon request to the Nasdaq Investor Relations Department,  Attention: Edward Ditmire, One Liberty Plaza, 49th Floor,   New York, New York 10006, in writing, or by email at   investor.relations@nasdaq.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 11. Who counts the votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. tabulates the votes and acts as  inspector of elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 18. How do I submit a proposal or director nomination for inclusion  in the 2018 Proxy Statement?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq stockholders who wish to submit proposals pursuant to  Rule 14a-8 of the Exchange Act for inclusion in the proxy statement  for Nasdaqs 2018 Annual Meeting must submit them on or before  November 29, 2017 to the Corporate Secretary and must otherwise  comply with the requirements of Rule 14a-8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12. When will the company announce the voting results?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preliminary results will be announced at the meeting and, thereafter,  final results will be reported in a current report on Form 8-K, which is  expected to be filed with the SEC within four business days after the  meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we amended our By-Laws to adopt proxy access, which  permits a stockholder, or a group of stockholders, owning at  least three percent of our outstanding shares of common stock  continuously for at least three years to nominate and include in the  proxy materials for an Annual Meeting director nominees constituting  up to the greater of two individuals and 25% of the total number  of directors then in office, provided that the stockholder(s) and  nominee(s) satisfy the requirements specified in the By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice  of director nominations submitted under these requirements must  be received no earlier than October 30, 2017 and no later than  November 29, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 13. How are proxies solicited, and what is the cost?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will pay the cost of soliciting proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may be solicited on  our behalf by directors, officers or employees (who will not receive  any additional compensation for these solicitations), in person or by  telephone, electronic transmission and facsimile transmission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq  will, upon request, reimburse banks, brokers and other nominees  for their reasonable expenses in sending proxy materials to their  customers and obtaining their proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have hired D.F. King & Co.,  Inc. to assist in soliciting proxies at a fee of $8,500 plus costs and  expenses for these services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14. What is householding, and how does it affect me?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Nasdaq stockholders may recommend individuals  for consideration by the Nominating & Governance Committee  for nomination to the Nasdaq Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders should submit  such recommendations in writing, together with any supporting  documentation the holder deems appropriate, to Nasdaqs Corporate  Secretary prior to December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nasdaq has adopted a practice approved by the SEC known as  householding to reduce printing and postage fees for the meeting  notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding means that stockholders who share the same  last name and address will receive only one copy of proxy materials,  unless we receive instructions to the contrary from any stockholder  at that address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you prefer to receive multiple copies of the proxy  materials at the same address, please contact the Nasdaq Investor  Relations Department by email at investor.relations@nasdaq.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 19. How do I submit other proposals or director nominations for  presentation at the 2018 Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our By-Laws also establish an advance notice procedure for other  proposals or director nominations that are not submitted for inclusion  in the proxy statement, but that a stockholder instead wishes to  present directly at an Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these procedures, a  stockholder must deliver a notice containing certain information, as  set forth in the By-Laws, to Nasdaqs Corporate Secretary not later  than the close of business on the 90th day nor earlier than the close  of business on the 120th day prior to the first anniversary of the prior years meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assuming the 2018 Annual Meeting is held according  to this years schedule, the notice must be delivered on or prior to the  close of business on February 9, 2018, but no earlier than the close of  business on January 10, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if Nasdaq holds its Annual  Meeting on a date that is more than 30 days before or 70 days after  such anniversary date, the notice must be delivered no earlier than  the close of business on the 120th day prior to the date of the Annual  Meeting nor later than the close of business on the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the  ninetieth day prior to the date of the Annual Meeting or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the tenth  day following the day on which public announcement of the date of  such meeting is first made by Nasdaq.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 15. Will you make a list of stockholders entitled to vote at the 2017  Annual Meeting of Stockholders available?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will make a list of holders entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting  available at the Annual Meeting and for at least 10 days prior to the  Annual Meeting, between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. (EDT),  at our principal executive offices (One Liberty Plaza, 50th Floor, New  York, New York 10006) and at the meeting location (Nasdaq, FMC  Tower, 2929 Walnut Street, Philadelphia, PA 19104).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 16. If I cannot attend in person, how can I participate in the live  webcast of the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To participate in the live webcast of the meeting, you can visit our  Investor Relations website at http://ir.nasdaq.com/annual-meeting- info.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An archived copy of the webcast will also be available on thi website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 17. How can I view or request copies of the companys corporate  documents and SEC filings?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual report on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q,  current reports on Form 8-K and any amendments to those reports  are available free of charge on the SEC Filings page of our Investor  Relations website, which can be found at http://ir.nasdaq.com/sec.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with rules of the SEC, instead of mailing printed copies of our proxy materials to each stockholder of record, we are  furnishing the proxy materials for the 2017 Annual Meeting by providing access to these documents on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A notice of Internet  availability of proxy materials is being mailed to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We first mailed or delivered this notice on or about March 29, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice of Internet availability contains instructions for accessing and reviewing our proxy materials and submitting a proxy over the  Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy materials were made available at www.proxyvote.com on the date that we first mailed or delivered the notice of  Internet availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice also will tell you how to request our proxy materials in printed form or by e-mail, at no charge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice contains a control number that you will need to submit a proxy for your shares.
